name: justificatory
content:

given as, containing, or relating to a justification (= reason or explanation) for something you have done, especially something bad: Many of the justificatory pretexts and rationalizations expressed today are similar to those advanced in the Third Reich. He acknowledged his lies and other wrongdoings in a justificatory counter-narrative.
More examplesFewer examplesThe book aims to correct justificatory misuses of political philosophy in our time.There seems to be no reason to deny that perceptual experience can play a justificatory role.They have proposed five justificatory conditions which may resolve conflicts among general moral considerations in public health ethics.A particular discourse that is characterized as justificatory may contain other elements.
